captions.text: ♪ [music]

Danny: I kind of progressed
into sort of trial riding,
you know, when I was a kid.

I dunno if it was the best way to try to
get girls or anything like that, you know.
I can't say that, come on.
I can't, you know.

Well the video that we put on YouTube
about autumn 2008,

we started filming it
and with my flat mate Dave Sowerby.

We made the video with
absolutely no expectation,

you know, like, we were both
really into the project and,

that's all I would think about
when I went to bed at night.

But we never in a million years
imagined that it would be,
you know, all over the place.
♪ [music]
We really made it for ourselves.

There was no such funding behind it
or anything like that.
We just, we made it for fun.

Pretty much the next day I actually
had like the BBC phoning me up
and all sorts of newspapers,

coz over night it had a few hundred
thousand views or something like that.

It's been really unbelievable how many
people have seen it all over the world
and the kind of reaction it's had.

>>"They're getting away."
"Over here!"
[crowd yelling:]

Danny: I'm so lucky that
the video's gone out to so many people,

and you know, now I get to do this
as my job.

So I don't really know
how I ended up here,
but it's been very fun time.
It's been really unbelievable.
Um. Yeah,

hopefully we can go on to make some bigger
and better things in the future, as well.
That's my main goal.
♪ [music]
